name: SceneCapture
description: Scene Capture is an Actor which captures a fully dynamic image of the scene into a Texture. It captures the scene from its view frustum, stores that view as an image, which is then used within a Material.

parameters.name: render_rate
parameters.description: Render Rate (how frequent is the capture)

parameters.name: enable_distance_optimization
parameters.description: Reduces the rendering frequency if the entities with this Material are too far

parameters.name: force_always_rendering
parameters.description: Forces it always re-rendering even if no Material using it is on screen

functions.name: AddRenderActor
functions.description: Adds an Actor to the Render Only list
functions.description_long:
Adds an Actor to the Render Only list

Note: adding one actor to this will make the SceneCapture only to render those Actors.

functions.name: RemoveRenderActor
functions.description: Removes an Actor from the Render Only list

functions.name: SetShowFlag
functions.description: Enables/Disables rendering features from being captured
functions.description_long:
Enables/Disables rendering features from being captured
A complete list of available flags can be found in the Official Unreal Documentation

functions.name: Resize
functions.description:
Change the output Texture size
Note: too high texture will make the capture slower and will affect game performance

functions.name: SetRenderRate
functions.description:
Set how frequent is the capture
Note: Setting to 0 will make it capture every frame

functions.name: SetDistanceOptimizationEnabled
functions.description: Enables or not the rendering frequency optimization if the entities with this Material are too far

functions.name: SetForceAlwaysRendering
functions.description: Forces it always re-rendering even if no Material using it is on screen
